page.title: 06HIGHFIELDS VILLAGE
page.content: There is just one road entering {Highfields village}which stands between the Old Great North Road and the Roman Ridge footpath. {Highfields}is a mining village therefore all the houses are pit houses. As you come into the village there is a bookmakers to the right and a general store to the left. The road divides at the war memorial clock. The two roads are roughly 850m long and the village is shaped like a thin isosceles triangle. The Miners Welfare Club and the village school both lie between the two roads. Some of the houses face out into the fields with their backs into the street. Some were having brick extensions built or were being modernised. Most of them have asphalt gardens and paths. The whole village is surrounded by an iron railing.
